reviews.review_msg: A really great professor, but a really hard course. Do all his homework assignments and you'll do well. Otherwise you'll be lost
Nice prof with really clear notes. The first part of the course is harder than the second part. The nice thing is he scales,if the whole class did bad!
A good teacher and a nice guy. But hard work is essential for his courses.
Exams are somewhat hard, but if you read the notes and go over examples you will realize that he is pretty fair with his exams. That being said you need to study for this guy.
A pretty chill and funny prof. He makes the lectures fun and very interesting! I definitely recommend taking a class with him
Good class where I learnt a lot about thermodynamics and heat transfer.

Thermo with THIS Dream Demolisher will be thee hardest C- you will ever work for in your life. I've never worked so hard in a class or done so much studying for everyone and myself to do so poorly on these impossible difficulty exams. Hardest class possible with hardest prof possible. Avoid if u can, I will tell my grandkids about him. Nice guy tho
Passion for teaching. A man with a plan no less. Quizzes on quizzes. 10/10

Passionate lecturer, wish he taught more courses in MSE. Makes you work hard, but if you do do all the homework itll pay off. His lectures are good, but he really pushes for participation so be ready. 4 exams no final, extra credit project.

Not allowed to say how I truly feel about this guy because it will get deleted for its vulgarity if I do. I will stick to the fact that not only is this guy a truly awful professor, but is also a terrible human being. His method of teaching is absolutely terrible and you will learn nothing yet he walks around like he is god's gift to earth.
All I'm saying is, if you have a chance choose another instructor. you are going to regret every moment of his class.

I loved being a student in his class. He really goes above and beyond to make sure you know your material and responds to emails very quickly. As long as you listen to him and study the material from tutorials youll be fine. If youre stuck somewhere, just send him and email and he will explain it in detail. Hes so caring and very respectful
Great prof. Amazing lectures. Super caring, kind and funny.

Dr. Sam is a great prof. He tries his best to explain concepts and is always available outside of class time for help. Is also very down to earth which makes him understanding as well. Overall, great prof. Study for those pop quiz's (he gives you the dates before hand). Exam questions are right out of the book. Fair marker. He should teach more
MSE321 is one of the toughest course at SFU but professor Sam made the classes more interactive and fun, which made the course look easier.

I got my MSE321 course with Sam last semester. He is one of the best profs I have ever had at the SFU. He is caring and easily accessible outside class. However, course is not easy and do not expect easy grade, as you will have to work on this course and do your best. If you put your effort, you will like this course and Sam!

Sam is one of the best profs I have ever had in MSE. Not only he's good at explaining the material but also the flexibility he gave to students. Thermodynamics is a tough course and he has taught this class well.
Good class that I found very useful and recommend everyone to take it with Sam.
Dr. Behfarshad is such a funny and great guy! Definitely take a class with him and he'll become your favorite prof.

Thermodynamics and heat transfer isn't an easy course but Sam (Ghasam) made it really enjoyable. His lectures are really organized, full of humor and he makes sure the students understand the material. Asking questions is encouraged and he clearly explains what he is looking for in an exam. He's really caring and nice! Will take again!!!
